storyInfo: The Durins begin setting about dressing their doomed city, and Avdotya is pondering how to convey her thoughts to the city's people, while Stitch instead opts to flee under the pressure.

attributes.content: You know, Master Edge, I'm kind of intrigued. What was Stitch's mentor like?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I just knew you had an ulterior motive for coming with me, you runt.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: You bother yourself with that Stitch boy an awful lot.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Hahah, you caught me red-handed.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: That's just the kind of guy I am, hoping for everyone to hit it off and make friends.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Then you'd love his mentor.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Finch Canvas was his name. Most well-loved architectural designer in all of Zeruertza.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: His style might've been leagues apart from the Durin vogue, but when he explained things, he always our hearts doing it.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: In his words, he'd, er, what was it...? Right, 'throw off our ceaseless desires.'
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: His arguments were unique, relatively, but the Zeruertzans loved him.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: So why would someone like him leave?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: That's the mystery.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: He just up and went, and never told anyone.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: That's... pretty weird for sure.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: As for the apprentice he left behind... we all recognize his talent, but, well, you've seen how he acts.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Hahah. I bet it's to do with how his teacher suddenly left?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: So we all reckon.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Oh? You got some results?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hrmm, let's take a look...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Verdict?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Ach. More or less how you predicted.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: We've got just under a month's time left.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: A month? Should be enough to enlarge the lifts, then.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Fancy meeting you here, Gavial.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Fancy me. Looks like you don't need me to pitch in anymore?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Mmm. This about does it for the survey.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Did you win over Avdotya?
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Sure did. She said she'll help talk the Zeruertzans into it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Good. All that's left should be putting out the official city-wide notice of the situation.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: It's not just deciding how to head to the surface. We've got to settle the matter of the dome too.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Huh? What's up with the dome?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Oh, silly me. Nearly forgot you aren't Durins.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Right. Calamity doesn't come for Durin cities so often, but it's a decent bet a Durin has his city wrecked at least once in his life.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: It doesn't haunt us to leave the homes we grew up in.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Contrarily, you see, we always make sure our cities are in the best condition before we leave them, so they greet destruction the finest they can be.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Wow, that kicks ass!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: So you think? It's only natural for us.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: And no matter why that hole's been sitting in the dome all this time, we've got to do something about it now.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Yeah, speaking of the dome, where's Stitch?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Eh? Wasn't he with you?
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: What? He said he was gonna find you guys.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial, do you need Stitch?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You know where he went?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Mm-hm. I met him when we came in. He didn't say anything to me, he just went outside the cave.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You solemnly swear to us you have a map, and now you tell us that map's likely in some book on a shelf somewhere?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: (Clears throat) I can hardly do anything about that.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I've had no interest in returning to the surface, after all. You should be content with the fact I could remember once seeing a forebear's map recorded in a book.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: If that cave network turns out to be as complex as you say, then I don't mind spending a little more of the time we do have.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: So, do you still remember what exactly that book was called?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I've forgotten. I vaguely recall it should be a travel log, detailing the Durin author's variegated experiences on the surface.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: What's the point of asking, anyway? It's not as if we can read Durish.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I can't, but don't forget. I've got my friends here.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Zumama. Zumama. Do you require help?
attributes.name: Strange Machine #0429

attributes.content: I want to find this travel log Avdotya's talking about, with a map recording the route through the cave network to the surface.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Library books: infrequently sorted. Difficulty of search: relatively high.
attributes.name: Strange Machine

attributes.content: If you find it, I'll give you all an intense round of maintenance.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Zumama: friend. Assist Zumama.
attributes.name: Strange Machine #0429

attributes.content: Assist Zumama. Assist Zumama.
attributes.name: Strange Machine

attributes.content: Fantastic. Take it away, then. I'll be waiting outside. Remember to shout for me if something gives you trouble.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Yep.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Also... High Priest.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Yes, I'm here.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Pitch in.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: What in the...?!
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: A friend of mine.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Shouldn't you have asked me first if I knew any Durish, Zumama?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Is there any way you wouldn't?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Oh. Are you still miffed I never told you about all this business underground?
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: You see, Zumama, if I regaled you about every last thing I knew, you could figure out how to construct an entire nomadic city and build it too before I finished.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: I personally believe the pursuit of knowledge has to rest at some point, though I'm not a person per se.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Will you help or not?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: If you'll pardon me once I find it.
attributes.name: High Priest

attributes.content: Deal.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Er, Inam, what are you standing at the library doors for?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: I'm waiting for someone. And you?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Library caretaker called me over to discuss something about refurbishing the place.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: He's been wanting to, but never got around to it. Now's a good chance.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: I've been a little curious about that.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Plenty of time's passed since the broadcast, and, okay, none of the city's Durins are panicking, but...
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Why are some even planning to refurbish their buildings?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Hm? Oh, right, you're a surface-dweller. I see, it would be lost on you.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: You have built those roving cities to avoid disasters, haven't you?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But we're different, see. Our cities can't move about.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Nomadicizing cities built underground would be much more of a challenge, yes.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Between you and me, I've heard of masters who've had thoughts of building cities just like that.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: You see, if we fit rock-crushers and borer planes and the like onto the dome, and slipped a base plate under the whole city, it might just be within reach.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Er... I'm not great with construction, but that sounds even crazier than our nomadic cities are.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: And I've never heard of anyone looking to actually pull it off, truth be told.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Anywho, our cities don't move. Unnomadic, if you will.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: But. Every one of our cities does have Originium vein detector facilities, which send off an alert when one of them encroaches.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: I wonder if those sensors could replace the jobs of Catastrophe Messengers...
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I've heard of them. It's not quite apples to apples, see, because the spread of Originium veins is the only thing our sensors can pick up on.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: True. Judging from what I've heard, there's also a stretch of time from vein discovery to vein activation, and outside of special circumstances like now, you'd plenty of time to evacuate.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But if hints of a Catastrophe were detected, getting so much time to react would be a miracle.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Circling backyou're used to abandoning your own cities, then?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Exactly the opposite, if I had to say.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Durins adore everything that ties to this land. We adore machinery, buildings, every city we build.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: But should disaster insist on its way, then our cities are bound to be destroyed.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: And if we're going to face up to that reality, then there's something we have to consider.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: A city's inhabitants leave it because of calamity, but calamity doesn't last forever. There'll be other Durins, maybe even our own offspring and theirs, who'll come upon that same land once again.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: They'll see the city's remains, they'll lament the disaster that befell it, but as the people who once lived and breathed in it, is that really all we want them to come and learn?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Is surrender our only choice, in the face of our inescapable fate?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: We don't accept that. We choose
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: We decide, before calamity strikes, what shape our city is going to greet its ruin in.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: We set out to make our progeny marvel at the fruits of our technology, to make them gasp at the traces we've left behind, to make them toast with their finest tipple to all our achievements.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Just as we find other fallen cities, and do the very same.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Of course we're sad to have to leave where we grew, but it's a sadness we're accustomed to.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: And in said times for us, upkeeping our city such that it's in best condition becomes more meaningful than ever, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: It's the body. It's what we call dressing our doomed city.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: It's such a... romantic notion.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Of course it is. The more straightforward reason is, we can build a brand new city in as quickly a few months, provided we bring the key industrial equipment and have our robots assisting.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: We'd never have the resources to spare for this otherwise.
attributes.name: Croque Diamondface

attributes.content: Haha. Yes, good point.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Er, is that... Stitch over there?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: This one... no.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: This one? Also no.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: This oneer, what's this doing here? I'll take it with me later.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: This book? It's a Kazimierzian knight novel... Is it yours?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Ah, right, you can at least tell what that one is. It slipped my mind...
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I suppose it is. I brought it from the surface.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: About that...
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: How exactly did a lone Ursus like you wander all the way from Ursus to a Durin city?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: My family all died in a noble conflict that had absolutely no honor to speak of, and I was forced to flee from my home.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Assassins trailed me throughout my escape, until I eventually fled into a cavern.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Its structure was as complex as the one above the lift here, and I happened to find such a lift that led underground.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And that's how I had the fortune to survive. It was that simple.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Oh, that sure was pretty lucky.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Do you have no other thoughts?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Were you hoping for any?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: ...*sigh* No wonder you're a friend of Gavial's.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I've heard a lot of stories similar to yours aboard Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: You're already lucky enough just to have survived.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Zeruertza's a good place. It'd be pretty nice, living somewhere like this.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: It is.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I thought, originally, I'd be a lot angrier about the circumstances I'd landed in.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: But had my family really been so guiltless, my parents so benevolent in their day-to-day, simply befallen by wicked men's hate?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: My father still cursed his antagonists more than he cared for his own family, right until his final moments.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: As I fled out from the back of our home, I knew nothing of even the whereabouts of my mother.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And II was no more than an insignificant sacrifice in a sea of Ursus noble conspiracy.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: You're right, I'm very lucky. That's why I have to cherish this hard-won luck as well as I can.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: For sure.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: You're cruising to pick a huge argument with Gavial, am I right?
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: What gives you that idea?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Because she might've talked you over, but thinking about it carefully, you never actually said what you really wanted to say.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: And you tried to argue with her again, but then you lost the opportunity, so your only choice was to bite your tongue.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I've seen a lot of people pissed off by Gavial's whole personalityshe gets me too, sometimesand you're the most obvious kind about it.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Alright, I admit it.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I've never met anyone like Gavial. Whether I'm Ursus or Durin, getting a handle on her is... elusive.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: If there's something you need to get off your mind, you can tell me. You've helped me out. I'll think about passing it onto her for you.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: I'll refrain. I'm not in straits that desperate yet.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: However, I do have a proposal.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: I have no plans to formally make a return to surface life.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Once the danger is past, I'll be proposing the Durins return underground.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Of course, contact can never be easily severed once made, and so breaking off dealings will be nigh-impossible. I recognize that much.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: And I admit that you, the Tiacauh of Acahualla, may be possible relational targets.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Thus, once the Durins rebuild their city underground, I'll invite you all to relocate from a rainforest void of anything, to the land beneath the surface.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: At that point, I'm sure even one of Gavial's nature will understand just how wonderful Durin society is.
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Hmm... yeah, we'll pass.
attributes.name: Eunectes

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Avdotya

attributes.content: Let's get back to that once we find the map.
attributes.name: Eunectes
